item.description:
fuck fuck fuck FUUUUUUUUUCK[/SIZE]!

Why is it always when I buy a good car, a better one appears on sale? :fffuuu:

whole 3k more, 2 less doors and a year older, but it’s FULL package and full leather trim. Absolutely MINT. Plus it was serviced at local BRABUS centre…fffffffffffffffffffffffffffffuuuuuuuuucccccccckkkkk…
Shit fuck cock fucking mother fucker goddamn it cocksucker.

item.title: Mercedes s-class w220 facelift owners manual
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Far be it from me to pass judgement, but why would you spend 10 grand on a car and then torrent a £10 handbook?

£10? Hahahaha, try £300 :lol: It’s what they ask for it in dealerships.
Thing is, it should come with the car, but shit.

Tis damn nice though, I love mercs. Shame I can only afford my Renault

Don’t sweat it though, I got pretty lucky, since I could help my old man to sell 3 cars before I bought my s600.
More precisely, 1989 MB e260, 1998 MB e430 and 1999 BMW 750li. Then we split the income in half. I was like :awesome:
All of them were in pretty good condition, since we in our family can take care about our cars.

Read full topic

item.title: Mercedes s-class w220 facelift owners manual
item.dc:creator: AI13
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

LOL, find me a “an older ferrari” here in this hellhole. Then I’ll consider it.
Plus, even if I hypotheticaly got it, who’s gonna do all the repairs? And for how much? This here is not US with testarossas scattering around all over CA.
Heck, it was a major trouble to find a decent w220 s-class here since all good cars are being exported to Scandinavia. Shit sucks.

This here, however, is a luxobarge in mint condition, good as new. For nearly nothing.

Really, it looks like a great deal. Mercedes make some very good cars which over all are significantly more reliable than Ferraris. Besides, it probably is safer than any Ferrari that you could find for 10k.

Read full topic

item.title: Mercedes s-class w220 facelift owners manual
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
I’m buying this one next monday. It’s s500 4-matic, december 2004 (last year that model was produces). Previously had a 2002 s600, but with 12-cylinder and 2 turbos it has proven that it’s too much of a burden. My mistake. But 0-60mph in 4.5 seconds felt gooooood.

Will cost me approx 10k pounds, but since I’ve managed to sell my previous one for 9k + my father lent me 3k - it’s a fucking bargain. Does not have a distronic and ABC suspension though - sucks. Plus it does not have a full leather trim like s600. But being a five-year car it’s nearly full 3 years younger. And cleaner.

Mind you, in the production year it costed 72k. And s600 probably even more. So yeah. Did I mention a fucking bargain?

Funny thing is that I wanted an R34 skyline for $30k a couple of years ago.

Read full topic
